DOC.brief_title: The Clinical Study Poorly Differentiated Head Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
DOC.detailed_description: Head neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma ( HNSCC ) one common head neck malignant tumor . Investigators find several patient early TNM stage poor differentiate HNSCC poor prognosis , yet someone advance TNM stage well differentiate HNSCC good prognosis . Hence , Investigators suggest prognosis factor survival rate probably related differentiation HNSCC , prognosis factor poorly differentiate HNSCC rare discuss controversy . Investigating prognostic factor poorly differentiate HNSCC undoubtedly crucial . About study , inclusion criterion follow part : patient poor differentiated HNSCC ; T1-4aN0-2M0 ; pathological examination : poor differentiate squamous cell carcinoma ; initial treatment ( primary , without surgery , radiotherapy chemotherapy ) ; range:18-70 year old ; KPS > 80 ; hemogram function main organ heart , lung , liver kidney normal ; endoscopy , CT MRI form different group ; sign inform consent file , good compliance . AND exclusion criterion : uncontrollable epileptic seizure , disorder central nervous system unconsciousness cause psychosis ; serious uncontrollable infection ; main organ system failure ( include heart , lung , liver kidney ) ; reject training ; high moderate differentiate squamous cell carcinoma
DOC.criteria: Patients poor differentiated HNSCC ; Patients within stage T14aN02M0 ; The pathological examination patient show poor differentiate squamous cell carcinoma ; Patients initial treatment ( primary , without surgery , radiotherapy chemotherapy ) ; 1870 year old ; KPS > 80 ; Hemogram function main organ heart , lung , liver kidney normal Having endoscopy , CT MRI Signed informed consent file , good compliance . Uncontrollable epileptic seizure , disorder central nervous system unconsciousness cause psychosis ; Serious uncontrollable infection ; Main organ system failure ( include heart , lung , liver kidney ) ; reject training ; High moderate differentiate squamous cell carcinoma
